That's a great idea! Using a spreadsheet to keep track of your bookings and itinerary is a fantastic way to stay organized, and creating a trip folder on Google Drive will help you access your documents easily from anywhere.

A travel wallet is also a great investment for keeping your physical documents and valuables organized and secure. It's always a good idea to have a dedicated place to store your important documents, such as your passport, travel insurance documents, and hotel reservations, as well as your valuables like cash, credit cards, and traveler's checks.

When choosing a travel wallet, consider the following features:

* Multiple compartments and pockets to keep your documents and valuables organized
* RFID-blocking material to protect your credit cards and passport from identity theft
* A secure closure, such as a zipper or Velcro, to prevent items from falling out
* A durable and water-resistant material to protect your belongings from the elements
* A compact design that fits easily in your purse, backpack, or pocket

Some popular travel wallet brands include Travelon, Lewis N. Clark, and Pacsafe.

Remember to also make digital copies of your important documents and leave them with a trusted friend or family member in case of an emergency.

You're getting close to your trip, and it sounds like you're well-prepared! Enjoy your time in Japan, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or need further assistance.
